New Records: England became the first men's team to hold both the T20 and 50-over World Cup titles simultaneously.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes scored an unbeaten 52 from 49 balls to lead England to victory.
Sam Curran took 3 wickets for 12 runs.
Adil Rashid took 2 wickets for 22 runs, including the crucial wicket of Babar Azam.
Chris Jordan took 2 wickets for 27 runs.
Shaheen Shah Afridi injured himself while taking a catch and could not complete his over.
England chased down the target of 138 with an over to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes redeemed himself from the 2016 T20 final where he was hit for four successive sixes by Carlos Brathwaite.
England's victory was seen as a significant achievement after their earlier defeat to Ireland in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
England secured their second T20 World Cup title, their first being in 2010.
Pakistan's campaign mirrored their 1992 World Cup journey but ended in defeat this time.
